Keywords: Asgardian , Deity , Guardians of the Galaxy , Mystical , Young Avengers
Real Name: Loki Laufeyson
Special Powers
RALLY (2): All attack rolls. FREE: Remove a RALLY die to place Loki in any square within 2 squares. If you did, generate a AFFE #026 Loki on click #9 in the square he last occupied. // If Loki started the game on click #9, he can't gain RALLY dice and has a 0 point value for all effects (including scoring). Protected: Pulse Wave.
Trade Loki Want Loki

Comments
February 21, 2022
odinson51303
TMT set was the last brick I bought before this set. I took a couple years off before coming back. So I swear by Loki from TMT. Now, I need several of these now. I have 2, and am looking forward to getting more.
January 30, 2022
Monkey Joe
[B][COLOR="Sienna"]Ill have to try this one out with Earth X Clea in a golden or silver age game since all his dupes also have Mystics [/COLOR]:D[/B]
January 13, 2022
Disasstah
This piece is one of the best Uncommons in the game. Not only is he getting rally dice almost every round, he's able to use it as a form of side step and can freely escape anyone that's trying to base him. Plus there's no restrictions on where he's placed, so you can to the other side of a wall, or even elevation. And the cherry on top? Those clones he makes have mystics which means there's a good chance that someone's taking damage to get these free clones off them.
January 6, 2022
The Singularity
No I just meant I use the prob even when I don't really need to just to fish for finalized d6 rolls with a 2. There are plenty of times where you know there's no way that roll is gonna work unless it's a crit hit, or there's no way this can miss I need a 3 or higher - so why not prob it to squirt out another Loki? By the time I have 3 on the board you've got insurance to prob it again and again if you don't like the roll.
January 6, 2022
notoriousv
"You get Rally die on rolls that are not finalized? I didn't realize that." This is not correct on the card it says you get the die from the finalized attack roll, so you cannot generate rally dies from multiple probs.
January 3, 2022
Dortmuner
You get Rally die on rolls that are not finalized? I didn't realize that. I played him once and I'm going to hate playing against him. We played a 3-way battle royale, so I was getting Rally die faster than I could use them. A huge pet peeve of mine is when you have to go through multiple probs hitting and rehitting your opponent until finally they make you miss and then you've wasted five good attack rolls. And here I was probbing an attack with five different Loki. I felt sick. He does what he's supposed to do really, really well, for better or worse. Needless to say, JLU Ace and AFFE T'Chaka II Prime are going to be staples on my team if anyone I play with gets too enamored with Loki.
January 3, 2022
The Singularity
Play Report: I have 5 of this guy now and he's AWESOME. Something I didn't really think of before is that once I have 3 on the board I just start prob-ing every roll I can to grab another 2 for his rally. He can multiply INCREDIBLY fast.
December 24, 2021
Maxphyte
Super fun figure to use. One of the few bright spots of the set. He plays like a more efficient version of TMT Loki. This one may not have the STOP click like TMT Loki, but his duplication isn’t limited like TMT Loki’s was because of that STOP click.
December 9, 2021
The Singularity
This looks like a very fun figure to play. And like Loki, don't ignore him too long or there will be a whole gang of his dupes full of prob to deal with.
October 28, 2021
Goop
I LOVE the design of this figure. You are either rolling well and hitting your opponent or you are rolling bad and this guy lets you generate more prob figures. What a clever idea. He's a win/win on your team, if left unchecked he can become very dangerous with tons of prob clones. He does have stealth/blades and range which is a bit of an odd combo. I'm annoyed he's an uncommon, might be tough to get multiples.
